actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-149, by Ms. Slaughter (NY).

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1989 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be read by title. Bill is open to amendments. It shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology now printed in the bill. All points of order aginst the substitute for failure to comply with clauses 5(a) and 8 of rule XXI shall be waived. It shall be in order to consider en bloc amendments offered by Representative Valentine and Representative Walker. Said amendments may amend unread portions of the substitute and shall not be subject to a demand for division of the question.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 38.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1989) to authorize appropriations for the National Institute of Standards and Technology and the Technology Administration of the Department of Commerce, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 1989 (science and technology funding).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1989) to authorize appropriations for the National Institute of Standards and Technology and the Technology Administration of the Department of Commerce, and for other purposes.
